content:
I'm happy to chat with you about your game, but I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have the ability to keep track of your personal activities or games. I'm a new conversation each time you interact with me, so I don't have any knowledge of your previous games or scores.

That being said, a score of 15 points in a half is a respectable performance in a pick-up game! However, the context of the game matters. Here are a few factors to consider:

1. Game format: Was it a full-court game, half-court, or a 3-on-3 or 4-on-4 game? The format can affect the pace and scoring opportunities.
2. Level of competition: Were you playing with experienced players, or was it a more casual game with friends?
3. Game duration: How long was the half? Was it a timed half, or did you play until a certain score was reached?
4. Your role in the game: Were you the primary scorer, or did you have teammates who contributed significantly to the score?

To give you a better idea, in a typical pick-up game, a score of 15 points in a half is a good performance, especially if you're not a professional player. However, it's essential to consider the context of the game to get a better understanding of your performance.

Feel free to share more about the game, and I can try to provide more insights!
